decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards using cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion, then using cards like Life from the Loam to continuously dredge cards back from the graveyard. By recurring creatures like Bloodghast and Prized Amalgam, the deck aims to create a recurring board presence that overwhelms the opponent. Conflagrate can then be used to deal direct damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to efficiently use the graveyard as a resource to power out threats and win the game through a combination of recursion and direct damage.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize cards like Faithless Looting, Life from the Loam, and Cathartic Reunion to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, enabling the player to repeatedly return creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast to the battlefield. This constant graveyard recursion creates a powerful board presence that can overwhelm the opponent and lead to quick victories through a combination of graveyard shenanigans and creature synergies.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base through land destruction spells like Stone Rain and Mwonvuli Acid-Moss, while also locking them out of certain colors with Blood Moon. The deck aims to ramp up quickly with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf, and then finish the game with powerful threats like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Stormbreath Dragon. Tireless Tracker and Courser of Kruphix provide card advantage and Thragtusk, Obstinate Baloth, and Inferno Titan serve as resilient threats. Overall, the strategy is to control the game through disruption and powerful creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, as well as direct damage spells like Lava Spike, Rift Bolt, and Lightning Bolt. The deck also prioritizes maintaining board control with cards like Searing Blaze and Grim Lavamancer. Boros Charm and Lightning Helix provide added reach and versatility. The mana base allows for consistent color access and efficient creature deployment. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggression and burn spells before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly putting multiple artifacts onto the battlefield, utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp up mana production. By equipping creatures with Cranial Plating and using cards like Steel Overseer to pump them up, the deck aims to deal large amounts of damage in short amounts of time. With an emphasis on cheap, efficient creatures and cards that provide extra value like Arcbound Ravager, the deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of attacks and pump effects.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents' game plans with various tax effects while simultaneously applying pressure through aggressive creature threats. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat out creatures and disrupting opponents' resources with Leonin Arbiter and Ghost Quarter, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game. Additionally, the deck includes various Eldrazi creatures with powerful abilities that can help control the board and disrupt opponents further. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure while disrupting opponents' mana base and game plan, ultimately emerging victorious through a combination of aggression and disruption.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly pump up and protect your infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, using cards like Vines of Vastwood, Mutagenic Growth, and Blossoming Defense. By using various pump spells and protection, you aim to deal 10 poison counters to your opponent, winning the game through infect damage. The deck also utilizes mana ramp with Noble Hierarch and land fetch cards like Windswept Heath to quickly bring out your infect creatures and pump spells. The strategy is to overwhelm your opponent with fast and lethal infect damage before they can set up their own defense.

The deck focuses on protecting its creatures with hexproof auras and quickly boosting their power and toughness to deal large amounts of damage to the opponent. By playing a mix of efficient creatures with hexproof and powerful aura enchantments, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish a strong defense. The key strategy is to build up one or two creatures with multiple auras attached to them, creating a massive threat that is difficult for the opponent to deal with. The deck also includes cards to protect against targeted removal and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on setting up a combo with Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Deceiver Exarch/Pestermite to generate infinite creature tokens and win the game. It also includes control elements like counterspells and removal spells to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's game plan. Blood Moon and Spreading Seas serve as additional disruption tools to slow down opponents, while Snapcaster Mage provides flexibility and value by recasting spells from the graveyard. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces while controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on assembling a combination of creatures that synergize with each other to generate an overwhelming board presence and potential win condition through various interactions. This toolbox approach allows flexibility in adapting to different situations and opponents, utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Collected Company to tutor for specific creatures. The key strategy involves using creatures like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, while utilizing cards like Viscera Seer and Walking Ballista to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes utility creatures and some removal spells for added versatility.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while quickly deploying threats of your own. By combining the disruptive elements of cards like Path to Exile, Tidehollow Sculler, and Thought-Knot Seer with the aggressive creatures like Flickerwisp and Eldrazi Displacer, you aim to control the game tempo and prevent your opponent from executing their strategy efficiently. The mana denial strategy provided by cards like Leonin Arbiter and Ghost Quarter further hinders your opponent's ability to develop their board, allowing you to quickly close out games with your powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on aggressively using life as a resource to power up Death's Shadow and other delve creatures like Gurmag Angler. It utilizes a combination of discard spells, removal, and cantrips to control the board while setting up a lethal threat. The deck aims to quickly reduce its own life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow, while using efficient removal and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The strategy is to apply pressure early and maintain a controlling position until a decisive victory can be achieved.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively, using cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt opponents' hands while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Death's Shadow. The deck aims to lower its own life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow, while also utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Street Wraith for card advantage and deck manipulation. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate to deal with opposing threats, along with counterspells like Stubborn Denial for protection. Additionally, the deck includes planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope for additional value and control.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's draws and resources through the use of Lantern of Insight, Codex Shredder, and Ensnaring Bridge. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek while also being able to tutor for key pieces with Whir of Invention. The deck utilizes artifacts and lands to maintain its strategy and win conditions. By denying the opponent the ability to draw relevant cards and locking them out of attacking with Ensnaring Bridge, the deck aims to grind out a victory through attrition.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using a swarm of Human creatures. By utilizing cards that provide mana acceleration, disruption, and buffs to the whole team, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. The deck focuses on synergy between its creatures, making each one stronger when played together. With a mix of powerful attackers and disruptive spells, this deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

This UR Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while setting up for a powerful win condition with Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. Using cards like Remand, Cryptic Command, and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to control the board and tempo of the game. Through the Breach provides a quick way to bring out Emrakul and close out the game. Blood Moon is included to punish greedy mana bases and slow down the opponent's plays. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through careful resource management and powerful threats.
